title: Five things you need to know today, July 27
title_page: Five things you need to know today, July 27
maintext:
Five things you need to know today, July 27
Take a look at the news in and around Odessa on Friday, July 27. Find complete local news coverage in the Odessa American every day, online at oaoa.com and our daily E-Edition at myoaoa.com.
1. An ordinance prohibiting commercial motor vehicles from traveling in the city limits is beginning to show its effect, as five truckers were found guilty of violating the law Wednesday.
2. Fine arts teachers are needed this fall at Ector County Independent School District. The district needs everyone from art teachers to band and choir directors.
3. The West Texas Film Festival returns for its third year Nov. 15 through Nov. 17 at the Jack Rodgers auditorium at Odessa College, 201 W. University Blvd.
4. The Odessa Police Department has received several complaints in reference to a phone scam as a person pretending to be an OPD officer.
5. IN SPORTS: There will be plenty of competition in the 26th edition of the Odessa Menâ€™s City Golf Championships.
